name: A. Perfect Pair
statement:
Let us call a pair of integer numbers , if at least one number in the
pair is greater than or equal to . Thus, the pairs (3, 3) and (0, 2) are
2-perfect while the pair (-1, 1) is not.Two integers , are written on
the blackboard. It is allowed to erase one of them and replace it with
the sum of the numbers, .What is the minimum number of such operations
one has to perform in order to make the given pair of integers -perfect?
